#
Patrick Liddy
DESIGN + BUILD
Learn More View Resume

Skills

With over 25 years experience in the digital industry, I have a diverse set of skills in technology, design, and business. I take a lean, iterative approach to problem solving in a process of continuous improvment. I am also an experienced project lead with a strong belief in collaborative, interdisciplinary teams.

Development

I have spent my career learning new technologies, including HTML5, JavaScript & jQuery, Handlebars, and Ember.js on the front end, with Ruby on Rails, node.js, and Express on the back.

User Experience

I applied my skills as an interactive developer to becoming a full-stack UX lead, with experience in research, ideation, design, strategy, and testing using the full array of UX tools and deliverables.

Strategy

I view technology as a potential solution. With experience discovering and refining business goals, user needs, and technical constraints, I am able to create solutions that meed the needs of multiple audiences.

Experience

I've had many job titles in my career, most of which didn't exist when I was in college. The way I have always looked at it, my occupation is creative problem solver. As technology evolves, there are new tools to learn, which means there are always new and creative ways to solve for unique challenges.

  • 1990–1995

    Visual Designer

    I built my skills in design, marketing, and digital media production and continued my education in computer science.

  • 1995–2001

    Interactive Developer

    My focus shifted to interactive media as a developer and designer. I learned to innovate with unproven technologies and invent solutions to new problems. As an early subject matter expert, I also taught several graduate courses in the subject.

  • 2001–2006

    Fabrication Designer

    Based in Las Vegas, I applied my digital skills to fabricating solutions to real world problems in home automation, interactive water features, and theatrical scenery. I also gained experience in fabrication techniques using wood, metal, and plastics.

  • 2007–2017

    UX Designer

    Returning to Boston, I applied my previous interactive experience to the emerging field of user experience design, working for a variety of small- to mid-sized digital agencies in Boston at all levels. I learned agile and lean approaches and worked closely with my development teams.

  • 2017+

    Creative Technologist

    Realizing the need for team members with strong skills in both technology and design, I completed a bootcamp at General Assembly to level up my skills. I am now able to rapidly prototype MVPs as part of a lean product development process or build full-stack applications as part of a team.

  • View Resume

Bootstrap Theme Builder

Bootstrap | Python | mySQL

This application is the first MVP for a tool that allows designer and developers to speak the same language. It allows a designer to create a Bootstrap theme to facilitate designing in the browser and build rapid prototypes that are on-brand.

The front end uses HTML5/CSS3 with two Bootstrap themes and a Python | mySQL back end.

  • Role: Full Stack Developer
  • Course: Harvard X: CS50
  • Date: February 2017
View Project

Snippet List

Full-Stack | Ruby on Rails

This application is a code snippet collector. The concept is simple. All developers have huge collections of bookmarks to articles, documentation, samples, etc. Each item in the collection has a title and open text field to hold a code sample that gets highlighted according to its language.

The front end uses a responsive SASS-powered Bootstrap layout with a custom view controller connected to a Ruby on Rails | mySQL back end.

  • Role: Full Stack Developer
  • Course: General Assembly WDI
  • Date: May 2017
View Project

File Bucket

Express | MongoDB | AWS S3

Filebucket is a Dropbox-like applicaiton that allows users to upload files into a virtual file system. Anyone can read or dowload files and owners can delete or rename their own files.

File information is stored in a MongooseDB database and files are hosted in an AWS S3 bucket. The client is built using Bootstrap and Handlebars.

  • Role: Team Lead
  • Course: General Assembly WDI
  • Date: May 2017
View Project

Tic Tac Pro

Reponsive SPA | Custom Bootstrap

The design of this game focuses on simplicity and modularity. The architecture leverages view states to manage the presentation layer based on game state and user authentication.

The applicaiton uses Bootstrap for responsive layout, RESTful APIs for authentication, and jQuery for DOM manipulation.

  • Role: Front End Developer
  • Course: General Assembly WDI
  • Date: April 2017
View Project

Digital Sales Aid

Hybrid iOS App | AWS S3

This hybrid iOS app is a digital sales aid for product reps who do not have consistent access to wi-fi in hospitals. The content updates are stored in the cloud and delivered on-demand, requiring infrequent updates.

The app is built using HTML5 in a PhoneGap framework with content updates from an Amazon S3 repository.

  • Role: Strategy/UX Lead and Technical Architect
  • Client: B. Braun
  • Date: 2014

Smart Home

SmartThings | Z-Wave | Zigbee

This smart home system integrates lighting, HVAC, and security through SmartThings. The system uses motion, presence, temperature, and time as inputs, along with in-wall tablet, mobile, and physical interfaces.

The system includes Z-wave and Zigbee mesh IoT networks, HTML-based iOS interfaces, Nest, Alexa, and IFTTT, along with custom Groovy applications.

  • Role: Designer, Installer, and Developer
  • Client: 50 Mill Street
  • Date: 2015

Vision Prototype

Lean UX | Responsive Design

This vision prototype was part of a Lean UX process to develop a system to deliver medical decision suppport and supporting content. The solution was developed along with a set of behavioral personas through several iterations and tested with users to validate the concept and make continuous improvements.

  • Role: UX Lead
  • Client: Consumer Medical
  • Date: 2016

Mobile Ethnography App

Mobile Design for iOS

This mobile app for iOS and Android enables consumer research community members to participate in mobile ethnography projects. Users can providing video and image-based media, along with in-the-moment insights for consumer experience research.

  • Role: UX Lead and Creative Director
  • Client: Communispace
  • Date: 2013

Digital Strategy

Roadmap | Concepting

As a capstone for the development of a three-year global web strategy, this platform concept was created in order to demonstrate the way in which brand, commerce, and customer support can be integrated into a single platform and delivered to browsers on any device.

  • Role: Strategy and Design Lead
  • Client: Hospira
  • Date: 2011
